column5: Just wondering if any of the trout fishers have caught/seen any suckers in the creeks yet, specifically in the Oshawa creek. Water still looks pretty dirty so i didn't want to go out for no reason.  Thanks again, Mike
I heard reports of some being caught but I think it's still a little early before large numbers start showing up.

Just took a walk down to the creek and it's not as dirty as i thought...maybe i'll be out there saunday fishing! Also after walking a .5km stretch of creek i saw in the current just before a slow moving pool 2 or 3 fish lined up...so i left them be, i'm guessing they were trout,  but there is some instinktive to get me out there this weekend!
That was likely your suckers
You think so, they were fairly dark fish and there was just the 3 of them in a line...Either way i just know there fish!
I was out last saturday and people have been catching them, they're defintely not in thick yet when I was there but some has came up already.
There's plenty of suckers on the creek
lots of suckers in the creeks down here
there was some in last weekend  I didnt catch any but the guy "fishing" near me with a 13 foot searcher lead in a 5 foot deep hole caught lots
But are they catching anything?  JF
I was on Bowmanville and caught a couple on Tuesday.   Still early, but some are in.  Trout seem to have already gone up.  Oshawa will be fairly similar.
I have been catching suckers on the Rouge River for 2 weeks now. Some nice 3 pounders.
^^ co sign, some fatter ones in there too   soon boys soon...
Suckers will be swimming here (North bay) shorlty aswell if they are not already running, will have to check next time im out.
What bait is good for Suckers ?

Ah great rain...meaing high fast moving dirty water....looks like i'll be out fishing some time next week i guess, unless the creek goes down a bit!  As for bait for suckers, use something in a calm pool...like a worm on a jig or some gulp.
Worms!!!
Worm's I figured  and thanks much
LOL ... he was youuur buddy   .. What a tool
Hooked into one on steely gear this past Thursday in the evening. They are there just not as plentifull quite yet. Wilmot though
